com.samsung.android.sdk.cup

Class ScupDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.cup.ScupDialog

  • public class ScupDialog
extends Object
    This class represents a Dialog

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ScupDialog.ActionButtonClickListener
      This listener interface is called when user click the system button.
      static interface  ScupDialog.BackPressedListener
      This listener interface is called when user click the back button in the dialog
      static interface  ScupDialog.CaptureListener
      This listener interface is called when captured image download is completed
      static interface  ScupDialog.GestureListener
      This listener interface is called when user flicks or taps on the screen.
      static interface  ScupDialog.TitleButtonClickListener
      This listener interface is called when user click the system button.

      • ANIMATION_NONE

        public static final int ANIMATION_NONE
        One of animation type. It means user does note use the animation
        See Also:
        setAnimationType(int), Constant Field Values

      • ANIMATION_TRANSLATE

        public static final int ANIMATION_TRANSLATE
        One of animation type. It means sliding (right to left) animation should be activated.
        See Also:
        setAnimationType(int), Constant Field Values

      • ANIMATION_ROTATE_X

        public static final int ANIMATION_ROTATE_X
        One of animation type. It means x-axis rotation animation should be activated.
        See Also:
        setAnimationType(int), Constant Field Values

      • ANIMATION_SCALE

        public static final int ANIMATION_SCALE
        One of animation type. It means scale animation should be activated.
        See Also:
        setAnimationType(int), Constant Field Values

      • ANIMATION_ALPHA

        public static final int ANIMATION_ALPHA
        One of animation type. It means fade in/out animation should be activated.
        See Also:
        setAnimationType(int), Constant Field Values

      • ANIMATION_TRANSLATE_REVERSE

        public static final int ANIMATION_TRANSLATE_REVERSE
        One of animation type. It means sliding (left to right) animation should be activated.
        See Also:
        setAnimationType(int), Constant Field Values

        Short duration of toast popup window.

        Long duration of toast popup window.
        See Also:

      • TITLE_BORDER_NONE

        public static final int TITLE_BORDER_NONE
        One of title border style. It means user does not use the border of title.
        See Also:
        setTitleBorderStyle(int), Constant Field Values

      • TITLE_BORDER_UNDERLINE

        public static final int TITLE_BORDER_UNDERLINE
        One of title border style. It means underline is displayed on bottom of title.
        setTitleBorderColor(int) and setTitleBorderWidth(float) influence the underline.
        See Also:
        setTitleBorderStyle(int), setTitleBorderColor(int), setTitleBorderWidth(float), Constant Field Values

      • TITLE_BORDER_MAX

        public static final int TITLE_BORDER_MAX
        The total count of title border state
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WIDGET_ALIGN_NONE

        public static final int WIDGET_ALIGN_NONE
        One of widget alignment on a dialog. It means the dialog aligns widgets to left-top.
        See Also:
        setWidgetAlignment(int), Constant Field Values

      • WIDGET_ALIGN_VERTICAL_CENTER

        public static final int WIDGET_ALIGN_VERTICAL_CENTER
        One of widget alignment on a dialog. If it is set, the dialog aligns widgets to vertical center.
        And it can be used with WIDGET_ALIGN_HORIZONTAL_CENTER.
        See Also:
        setWidgetAlignment(int), Constant Field Values

      • WIDGET_ALIGN_HORIZONTAL_CENTER

        public static final int WIDGET_ALIGN_HORIZONTAL_CENTER
        One of widget alignment on a dialog. If it is set, the dialog aligns widgets to horizontal center.
        And it can be used with WIDGET_ALIGN_VERTICAL_CENTER.
        See Also:
        setWidgetAlignment(int), Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScupDialog

        public ScupDialog(Context context)
        Creates a ScupDialog instance
        Dialog will be shown after return of onCreate().
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If context parameter is null.

    • Method Detail

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Destroys a ScupDialog instance.
        If the dialog is shown on the screen, dialog should be hidden automatically.
        And if the dialog has widgets, widgets should be destoryed too.

      • setDebugCommand

        public void setDebugCommand(String debugCmd,
                   int number)
        Set Specific Command for debugging.
        Parameters:
        debugCmd - the specific debug command.
        If set "Show me the outline of widgets" with number 1, all widget should be display the outline.
        If number 0 in same case, outline should be disappeared.
        number - Specific code for debugging command

      • requestCapture

        public Bitmap requestCapture(ScupDialog.CaptureListener listener)
        Sets capture listener. Refer to ScupDialog.CaptureListener
        Parameters:
        listener - The callback that will run
        Returns:
        Captured bitmap
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If listener is null.

      • getId

        public short getId()
        Gets the instance id of this instance.
        Returns:
        Instance id. If this dialog is not created yet or already finisheded, it returns 0.

      • getContext

        public Context getContext()
        Gets the context instance that you provided.
        Returns:
        The context instance.

      • update

        public boolean update()
        Update dialog Before call this method, all of configuration will not be applied to device side.
        Returns:
        true

        public void setBackgroundColor(int color)
        Sets the background color
        Parameters:

        Set this to null to initialize the background image.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(int strResourceId)
        Sets the title text.
        Parameters:
        strResourceId - The String resource Id.
        Throws:
        Resources.NotFoundException - If strResourceId is invalid.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(String title)
        Sets the title text.
        If title is null or empty string, title bar of dialog will be disappeared.
        Parameters:
        title - The title text

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(String title,
            int resId)
        Sets the title text with icon.
        If title is null or empty string and icon is invalid, title bar of dialog will be disappeared.
        Parameters:
        title - The title text
        resId - The icon resource id
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If resId is invalid.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(String title,
            Bitmap icon)
        Sets the title text with icon.
        If title is null or empty string and icon is null, title bar of dialog will be disappeared.
        Parameters:
        title - The title text
        icon - The icon bitmap

      • getTitleTextColor

        public int getTitleTextColor()
        Gets the title text color.
        Returns:
        The title color

      • setTitleButton

        public void setTitleButton(Bitmap icon)
        Sets the button icon of title. this button icon will be shown the end of title area.
        If icon is null, title button will be disappeared.
        Parameters:
        icon - The button icon image bitmap

      • setTitleButton

        public void setTitleButton(int resId)
        Sets the button icon of title. If iconResId is invalid, title button will be disappeared.
        Parameters:
        resId - The icon resource id
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If resId is invalid.
        See Also:
        setTitleButton(Bitmap)

      • setActionButton

        public void setActionButton(Bitmap bitmap)
        Sets the action button with icon.
        The action button is shown left side on dialog.
        If active this button. you can receive click listener. If bitmap is null, the specified button will be disappeared.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The button icon.

      • setActionButton

        public void setActionButton(int resId)
        Sets the action button with icon.
        Parameters:
        resId - The resource id of the button icon.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If resId is invalid.

      • setActionButtonBackgroundColor

        public void setActionButtonBackgroundColor(int[] color)
        Sets the background color of action button.
        Parameters:
        color - The background color array. color value is an ARGB8888 format.
        Array size can not over BUTTON_STATE_MAX. Each index means button states.
        BUTTON_STATE_NORMAL,BUTTON_STATE_PUSH, BUTTON_STATE_SELECT and BUTTON_STATE_DISABLE.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If color size is invalid.

      • getActionButtonBackgroundColor

        public int[] getActionButtonBackgroundColor()
        Gets the background color of action button.
        Returns:
        The color array

      • setActionButtonBackgroundImage

        public void setActionButtonBackgroundImage(Bitmap[] image)
        Sets the background images of action button.
        Parameters:
        image - The image bitmap array. Array size can not over BUTTON_STATE_MAX.
        Each index means button states.
        BUTTON_STATE_NORMAL,BUTTON_STATE_PUSH, BUTTON_STATE_SELECT and BUTTON_STATE_DISABLE.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If image size is invalid.

      • setActionButtonBackgroundImage

        public void setActionButtonBackgroundImage(int[] resIds)
        Sets the background image of action button.
        Parameters:
        resIds - The image bitmap array. Array size can not over BUTTON_STATE_MAX.
        Each index means button states.
        BUTTON_STATE_NORMAL,BUTTON_STATE_PUSH, BUTTON_STATE_SELECT and BUTTON_STATE_DISABLE.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If resId size is invalid or each resource id is invalid.

      • setActionButtonClickListener

        public void setActionButtonClickListener(ScupDialog.ActionButtonClickListener listener)
        Sets the action button listener If listener is null, action button will be disappeared.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener

      • setWidgetGap

        public void setWidgetGap(float gap)
        Sets the gap between each widgets in dialog.
        The default gap is 1.5 point. so each widgets in dialog put distance 1.5 point.
        Parameters:
        gap - The gap of dp units.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If gap is negative.

      • getWidgetGap

        public float getWidgetGap()
        Gets the gap between widgets
        Returns:
        The gap of dp units.

      • setAnimationType

        public void setAnimationType(int type)
        Set animation type. This animation will be shown just after onCreate() You should complete all of preparation in onCreate()
        Parameters:
        type -
        It is one of ANIMATION_NONE, ANIMATION_TRANSLATE , ANIMATION_ROTATE_X, ANIMATION_SCALE , ANIMATION_ALPHA and ANIMATION_TRANSLATE_REVERSE
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If type is invalid.

      • setBackPressedListener

        public void setBackPressedListener(ScupDialog.BackPressedListener listener)
        Sets the backpressed listener
        Parameters:
        listener - The callback that will run

      • setGestureListener

        public void setGestureListener(ScupDialog.GestureListener listener)
        Sets listener. Refer to ScupDialog.GestureListener
        Parameters:
        listener - The callback that will run

      • setBackEnabled

        public void setBackEnabled(boolean enable)
        Sets whether this back-action is enabled in the dialog. If disabled, it will not handle back-action.
        Parameters:
        enable - Set true to enable it.

      • isBackEnabled

        public boolean isBackEnabled()
        Checks whether back-action should be enabled in the dialog.
        Returns:
        True if back-action is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setTitleBorderColor

        public void setTitleBorderColor(int color)
        Sets the border color of the title
        Parameters:
        color - border color

      • getTitleBorderColor

        public int getTitleBorderColor()
        Gets the border color of the title

      • setTitleBorderWidth

        public void setTitleBorderWidth(float width)
        Sets the border width of the title
        Parameters:
        width - border width
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If width is negative.

      • getTitleBorderWidth

        public float getTitleBorderWidth()
        Gets the border width of the title
        Returns:
        The border width of the title

      • setTitleBorderStyle

        public void setTitleBorderStyle(int style)
        Sets the border style of the title.
        It is one of TITLE_BORDER_NONE or TITLE_BORDER_UNDERLINE. Default value is TITLE_BORDER_UNDERLINE.
        Parameters:
        style - title border style
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If style is invalid type.

      • getTitleBorderStyle

        public int getTitleBorderStyle()
        Gets the border style of the title.
        Returns:
        One of TITLE_BORDER_NONE or TITLE_BORDER_UNDERLINE.
        See Also:
        setTitleBorderStyle(int)

      • showToast

        public void showToast(String msg,
             int duration)
        Show the toast for the specified duration.
        Parameters:
        msg - The text to show. Can be formatted text.
        duration - How long to display the message. Either TOAST_DURATION_SHORT or TOAST_DURATION_LONG

      • setWidgetAlignment

        public void setWidgetAlignment(int align)
        Sets the alignment of widget in dialog. It is one or more (separated by '|') of WIDGET_ALIGN_NONE,WIDGET_ALIGN_HORIZONTAL_CENTER or WIDGET_ALIGN_VERTICAL_CENTER
        Parameters:
        align - The widget alignment
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If align is invalid.

      • getWidgetAlignment

        public int getWidgetAlignment()
        Returns the alignment of widget
        Returns:
        One of WIDGET_ALIGN_NONE, WIDGET_ALIGN_HORIZONTAL_CENTER, or WIDGET_ALIGN_VERTICAL_CENTER.
        See Also:
        setWidgetAlignment(int)
